--- title: "Extras - Model deployment" subtitle: "Advanced tidymodels" format: revealjs: slide-number: true footer: include-before-body: header.html include-after-body: footer-annotations.html theme: [default, tidymodels.scss] width: 1280 height: 720 knitr: opts_chunk: echo: true collapse: true comment: "#>" fig.path: "figures/" --- # Deploy your model ![](hexes/vetiver.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} ## {background-image="https://vetiver.rstudio.com/images/ml_ops_cycle.png" background-size="contain"} ::: {.cell} ::: ## Deploying a model ![](hexes/vetiver.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} We have a decision tree, `tree_fit`, to model whether or not a taxi trip in Chicago included a tip or not. How do we use our model in **production**? ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(vetiver) v <- vetiver_model(tree_fit, "taxi") v #> #> ── taxi ─ model for deployment #> A rpart classification modeling workflow using 6 features ``` ::: Learn more at ## Deploy your model ![](hexes/vetiver.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} How do we use our model in **production**? ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(plumber) pr() %>% vetiver_api(v) #> # Plumber router with 4 endpoints, 4 filters, and 1 sub-router. #> # Use `pr_run()` on this object to start the API. #> ├──[queryString] #> ├──[body] #> ├──[cookieParser] #> ├──[sharedSecret] #> ├──/logo #> │ │ # Plumber static router serving from directory: /Users/simoncouch/Library/R/arm64/4.2/library/vetiver #> ├──/metadata (GET) #> ├──/ping (GET) #> ├──/predict (POST) #> └──/prototype (GET) ``` ::: Learn more at :::notes Live-code making a prediction ::: ## Your turn {transition="slide-in"} ![](images/parsnip-flagger.jpg){.absolute top="0" right="0" width="150" height="150"} *Run the `vetiver` chunk in your `.qmd`.* *Check out the automated visual documentation.* ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
05:00
``` ::: :::

include-after-body:
<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
